instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]2012 21" iMac shut down issues
threads.message:
Hey!
I have an iMac that "seems" to be in good working condition once booted, but has these weird issues.

- When I plug in power, fans go high indefinitely until I press the power button then it chimes and boots into O.S. like normal. Then when I shut down from O.S., it seems like it shuts down but it never does. The screen goes black and fans run high again until I press power button, then it boots all over again. I cant even hold the power button to cut power.
- When I try to run ASD it gets stuck after initial POST test. Keyboard and mouse will not work when this happens.
- Fans go high when it goes to sleep.

History - Came in with no video. Someone put a fuse in place of L9100. Other than that, it looks fine.

Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2012 21" iMac shut down issues
threads.message: Shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> is the common one one these.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2012 21" iMac shut down issues
threads.message: Thanks man...  Have a good night.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2012 21" iMac shut down issues
threads.message: Hit it right on the nose. Thank you Duke.
